To Sam Rayburn ISD Parents/Guardians,

We are looking forward to the 2020-21 school year that will begin on August 17th. Even though final decisions have not been made at the Texas Education Agency concerning all aspects of opening the school year, we do want you to know that each parent will have the option of choosing traditional in-person instruction or remote online instruction if you are not comfortable with the traditional setting. Remote instruction will consist of recorded lessons, assignments, projects, and interaction with teachers online and/or by phone during a specific time frame. In the next two weeks, each family will be contacted by a SRISD staff member via phone to gather information in order to properly plan for the upcoming year. Please be assured that our number one priority is always the health and safety of our students. Thank you for your continued support of Sam Rayburn ISD.

Steve Arthur
Interim Supt.

Basketball games will be played as scheduled since we have little flexibility in rescheduling these district matches at this time of year. We hope you make the next four days productive by resting and getting well. Please seek medical attention if needed in order to get better. We want our SR Rebels healthy and back on Wednesday of next week.

Our Second Annual JH/HS Science Fair was a huge success! We had a big turnout, and we truly appreciate all who came to support our students. With so many great projects, our judges had a hard time determining projects to send to finals. After hours of judging, the following projects made the cut:

Junior High Results-

Grand Champion
Case Nichols and Clay Caldwell (Hook, Line, and Sinker)
These two young men will be advancing to the regional competition in Dallas next month.

Reserve and Principal's Choice
Carson Burkard (How Much Sugar is in Your Soda?)

Reserve
Sidney Reece and Angel Jennings (Pulse Jet)

Principal's Choice
Stevie Davis and Ally McCraw (Bacteria Growth)

High School Results-

Grand Champion
Chloe Smith (Pork Heart Rate)

There were lots of blue and red ribbon winners as well. Good job to all students who participated. A special thanks to Michele Mackey and Virgina Beaver for all of your behind the scenes work that goes into making our science fair a huge hit.

SRISD will hold a public meeting on Monday, January 20th, at 7:00 p.m. to discuss the possibility of hiring a full-time, uniformed SRISD school resource officer. Several schools around the area have full-time police officers on staff. This is not in reaction to anything, but instead another safety precaution that enhances school district security. It will not replace any safety programs that we are currently doing. We would like to hear the public's opinion on the idea. This officer would be employed full-time in district and also provide security at after-school events where security is already required now. We invite you to share your opinion on the possibility at the meeting:

Monday, January 20th
7:00 p.m., SRISD cafeteria
We will have school safety experts on hand to answer your questions!
